image.altText: People gather at Lake Burley Griffin to dragon boat

props.synopsis: More than 300 of Australia's best paddlers have travelled to Germany to compete in next week's World Dragon Boat Racing Championships — and there are 32 Canberra-based competitors among them.

title.children: The Canberrans taking the world stage in this niche sport

image.altText: A woman in a pink sweater and black vest.

props.synopsis: Christine Yerbury has been waiting since October to receive an occupational therapy assessment to allow her to receive a Deaf-appropriate device.

title.children: 'It's just not safe for me': Christine is Deaf and needs a new home

image.altText: Three women standing beside a medical bed with a fake person in it.

props.synopsis: Canberra Health System has reported an increase in the number of occupational violence incidents. But it's not all bad news.

title.children: The methods being used in Canberra to reduce hospital violence

image.altText: A young man wearing a t-shirt, standing in front of a rural paddock.

props.synopsis: After a tragic loss, this rural town took the mental health of its shearing community into its own hands, and hopes to spread the message to every shed across the country.

title.children: His mate's death left an 'empty space', so Leigh's filling it with hope

image.altText: A hallway with carpet with rows of bikes.

props.synopsis: ACT Policing located the goods, estimated to be worth upwards of $50,000, in a serviced apartment.

title.children: AirTag helps uncover stolen stash of bikes and scooters in Canberra

image.altText: A woman in a green blouse with blonde hair.

props.synopsis: Police say a man was shot in the leg after two men in hoodies allegedly invaded his house during the night.

title.children: Police search for alleged home invaders after man shot in leg

image.altText: Oliver sits and smiles, holding his saxaphone.

props.synopsis: Plans to overhaul the 60-year-old ANU School of Music, including dropping one-on-one instrument lessons, have been met with shock and dismay by students and former staff.

title.children: 'Defies any logic': Staff, students react to ANU School of Music plan

props.synopsis: This view inside some of the most precious and rare museum specimens on Earth is helping scientists to better understand the story of life — and it's all done without a scalpel in sight.

title.children: When these Tasmanian tigers were analysed, something peculiar stood out

image.altText: A rock carving of an lizard on red rocks

props.synopsis: The UNESCO has approved World Heritage status for the 50,000-year-old rock art of Murujuga, in Western Australia in Paris.

title.children: UNESCO approves World Heritage bid for rock art over emissions concerns

image.altText: Erin Patterson looks at the camera as she sits in the back of a prison van

props.synopsis: As the jury revealed its verdict, a tension built over weeks of legal arguments and disputed versions of what happened the day Erin Patterson hosted her in-laws for lunch was resolved.

title.children: In a matter of minutes, Erin Patterson's murder trial was over

image.altText: A woman stands for a photo in front of a koala exhibit at the zoo with children whose faces are blurred

props.synopsis: It remains unclear how many Australians and their families remain stuck in Iran, more than two weeks after a US-brokered ceasefire with Israel was implemented.

title.children: Australian grandmother who fled Iran overland says DFAT 'not helpful'

image.altText: Two young boys in beenies pose with platic toy guns.

props.synopsis: Record numbers of drones and missiles are increasingly being launched at Ukrainian cities, in what analysts say appears to be a new Russian tactic.

title.children: More than 700 drones and counting as Russia ramps up new war tactics

image.altText: A black and white group portrait of the English football team

props.synopsis: This year's British and Irish Lions will play nine matches on Australian soil. Their first forebears though played 35 matches in Australia, 19 of which were under Australian Rules. And they even beat one of the leading sides of the day.

title.children: When the Lions first came to Australia, over half their games were Aussie Rules

image.altText: A multi-storey brick building has a severely damaged roof and top floor after an attack

props.synopsis: The drones hit the medical facility in the city of Kharkiv, sending patients scrambling to protect their newborn babies.

title.children: Russian drones hit maternity hospital in Kharkiv, terrorising families

image.altText: GHF image Rafah

props.synopsis: The United Nations says most of those killed had been close to aid sites managed by the US and Israel-backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation.

title.children: UN says almost 800 people killed near Gaza aid hubs in in six weeks

image.altText: A male AFL player in a red kit roars with passion, exposing his teeth which are covered by a mouth guard

props.synopsis: Gold Coast captain Noah Anderson stands tall when his team requires him the most as the Suns take a major step towards reaching the finals for the first time in club history.

title.children: Anderson drills incredible solo goal as Suns survive Pies heist attempt

image.altText: Nicho Hynes celebrates

props.synopsis: The Sharks led the Dolphins 14-0 before two late tries gave the Redcliffe side a sniff. But Nicho Hynes scored a match-winning try to save the Sharks' faltering NRL season with a 24-12 victory.

title.children: Sharks hold out fast-finishing Dolphins to claim desperate victory

image.altText: a  man embraces and passionately kisses a vacuum cleaner while lying in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: A film about woman who dies from dust pollution and returns to posses her husband's vacuum cleaner is just one of the recent examples of cinema building Thailand's reputation for distinctiveness and creativity.

title.children: Why Thai dramas punch above their weight on the world stage

image.altText: A man with black hair and glasses wears a face mask while animated spike proteins surround him

props.synopsis: As influenza cases rise, so do the number of myths about how to treat it. We separate fact from fiction in this quiz. Let’s see how you go.

title.children: Think you know how to protect yourself from influenza? Take this quiz

image.altText: Jannik Sinner shakes hands with Novak Djokovic at the net at Wimbledon.

props.synopsis: As Jannik Sinner prepares to meet Carlos Alcaraz in another grand slam final, the Italian world number one says they have a few years to go before their rivalry can be compared to that between Roger Federer, Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic.

title.children: Sinner says Big Three comparisons too early ahead of Wimbledon final

image.altText: Large red gallery room with gold-bordered paintings hanging on the wall and several people looking up at them.

props.synopsis: Some often-reproduced French Impressionist paintings might feel very familiar, but to see them in person is to experience them in an entirely new way, curator Katie Hanson says.

title.children: Sexy cherries, 1860s fashion and rage: What to expect at new art exhibition

image.altText: the wind blows balck and yellow flags with yellow writing attached to fences of building sites with buildings behind

props.synopsis: It’s the open secret that festered on Queensland job sites for years. The bombshell CFMEU report leaves many questions unanswered, writes Alex Brewster.

title.children: Can the CFMEU be saved? Questions remain after bombshell Queensland report

image.altText: Albanese g7

props.synopsis: Thirty-six-year-old Alexander Phillip David Keating allegedly made threats to murder Anthony Albanese in the lead-up to the May federal election.

title.children: Sydney man charged over death threats made against Albanese

image.altText: A man climbs through the window of a moving van.

props.synopsis: A man has been arrested after a dramatic daylight police chase that saw a damaged van swerve through traffic while being pursued along a busy Melbourne freeway.

title.children: Video shows man leaping from moving van during dramatic police chase

image.altText: A young man sits in a wheelchair and holds a guitar while smiling, with a young woman next to him with a big grin on her face.

props.synopsis: ToyNera Macgregor says her son Annan is no longer safe at home due to his significant disabilities, and that the NDIS has failed to provide the extra support he needs.

title.children: Mum pushing to keep son in hospital says NDIS plan not keeping him safe

image.altText: Golden coins featuring the logos of popular cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin, DOGE and Ethereum

props.synopsis: Scammers have used promises of lucrative investments, romantic relationships, and pleas for assistance to steal $2.5 million from 15 Tasmanians. Police say the victims will suffer life long impacts.

title.children: 15 people lose combined $2.5 million to crypto ATM scams

image.altText: A dark-haired, middle-aged man in a warm vest stands near a brick building behind a fence.

props.synopsis: A NSW hospital that has been operating under reduced hours since 2023 has been beset by operational failures that must be addressed, an independent review has found.

title.children: Leadership instability at hospital that shuts at 5:30pm, review finds

image.altText: A poster showing three people dressed in Nazi uniforms.

props.synopsis: A man is charged under laws banning the display of Nazi symbols, over a shopfront poster depicting Coalition politicians and mining magnates as German World War II soldiers.

title.children: Man charged over poster depicting politicians and billionaires as Nazis

image.altText: a man behind the bar of a pub

props.synopsis: Pubs, cafes and restaurants are legally restructuring to wipe their debts and stay open, as the hospitality industry continues to battle tough trading conditions.

title.children: 22 cents to the $1: How a pub legally wiped debt and stayed open

image.altText: A court sketch of a middle-aged man with short dark hair wearing a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: A drug dealer who fired a shotgun through the front window of a home in suburban Perth, killing an innocent man in his own bedroom, is found guilty of murder.

title.children: Drug dealer convicted of murdering innocent man in bedroom

image.altText: Close-up picture of the red imported fire ant.

props.synopsis: Fire ants have been detected in central Queensland for the first time, at a mine site near Moranbah, inland from Mackay.

title.children: First outbreak of invasive fire ants detected in central Queensland

image.altText: kids wearing warm clothes sitting by the water

props.synopsis: While it can be frustrating for parents and caregivers at times, experts says kids' innate urge to explore independence — like choosing their own clothes — is healthy.

title.children: Your child refuses to wear warm clothing. Does it matter?

image.altText: Man with white beard, black-rimmed glasses and grey hoodie

props.synopsis: A nursing student desperate to prove he did not use prohibited artificial intelligence software to complete a workbook says his reputation is on the line, but Murdoch University is holding firm.

title.children: Uni student accused of using AI in assignment fights to clear his name

image.altText: An unidentified teenager stands next to wire fence and checks a phone

props.synopsis: Child victims of domestic violence have told a South Australian royal commission about being beaten, imprisoned in their own homes and made to feel "unloved", but felt ignored when they tried to disclose the abuse. Warning: This story contains content that may distress some readers.

title.children: 'I'm not very loved': Children share domestic violence experiences

image.altText: A greyscale image of solar material being ejected from the sun

props.synopsis: The US space agency reveals highly-detailed imagery of massive plumes of solar material spewing out into space.

title.children: NASA releases images taken at probe's closest ever distance from the sun
